edu.illinois.library.cantaloupe.image

Class Crop

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.illinois.library.cantaloupe.image.Crop
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Operation

    public class Crop
extends java.lang.Object
implements Operation

    Encapsulates a cropping operation.

    Note that isFull() can be assumed to take precedence over all other properties.

    • Method Detail

      • fromRectangle

        public static Crop fromRectangle(java.awt.Rectangle rect)
        Parameters:
        rect - Rectangle to imitate.
        Returns:
        Crop instance analogous to the given rectangle.

      • getHeight

        public float getHeight()
        Returns:
        The height of the operation. If getUnit() returns Crop.Unit.PERCENT, this will be a percentage of the full image height between 0 and 1.

      • getRectangle

        public java.awt.Rectangle getRectangle(java.awt.Dimension fullSize)
        Parameters:
        fullSize - Full-sized image dimensions.
        Returns:
        Crop coordinates relative to the given full-sized image dimensions.

      • getResultingSize

        public java.awt.Dimension getResultingSize(java.awt.Dimension fullSize)
        Specified by:
        getResultingSize in interface Operation
        Parameters:
        fullSize - Full size of the source image on which the operation is being applied.
        Returns:
        Resulting dimensions when the operation is applied to an image of the given full size.

      • getUnit

        public Crop.Unit getUnit()

      • getWidth

        public float getWidth()
        Returns:
        The width of the operation. If getUnit() returns Crop.Unit.PERCENT, this will be a percentage of the full image width between 0 and 1.

      • getX

        public float getX()
        Returns:
        The left bounding coordinate of the operation. If getUnit() returns Crop.Unit.PERCENT, this will be a percentage of the full image width between 0 and 1.

      • getY

        public float getY()
        Returns:
        The top bounding coordinate of the operation. If getUnit() returns Crop.Unit.PERCENT, this will be a percentage of the full image height between 0 and 1.

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull()
        Returns:
        Whether the crop specifies the full source area, i.e. whether it is effectively a no-op.

      • isNoOp

        public boolean isNoOp()
        Specified by:
        isNoOp in interface Operation
        Returns:
        Whether the crop is effectively a no-op.

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        public java.lang.String toString()

        No-op
        none
        Percent
        x%,y%,w%,h%
        Pixels
        x,y,w,h
